original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (5)
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The Paṭṭhāna Treatise in the Abhidhamma Piṭaka

original: 17.1. Kusalattika, Vedanāttika
analyzed: kusala attika vedanā attika
translated: The Triad on the Wholesome, the Triad on Feeling

original: Namo tassa Bhagavato Arahato Sammāsambuddhassa.🔽Kusalaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Kusalaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa  kusalam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā kusalam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhamma
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.

original: paṭicca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …pe…🔽kusalaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto ca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … pañca.
analyzed: paṭicca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pe  kusalam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayutto ca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā pañca
translated: With respect to a wholesome thought associated with pleasant feeling, there is an unwholesome thought associated with unpleasant feeling that is a condition, by way of root cause condition. With respect to a wholesome thought associated with pleasant feeling, there is an unwholesome thought associated with unpleasant feeling that is a condition, by way of object condition. …🔽With respect to a wholesome thought associated with pleasant feeling, there is an unwholesome thought associated with unpleasant feeling that is a condition, by way of object condition. …🔽With respect to a wholesome thought associated with pleasant feeling, there is an unwholesome thought associated with unpleasant feeling that is a condition, by way of object condition. …

original: Akusalaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya
analyzed: akusalam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya
translated: With respect to an unwholesome thought associated with unpleasant feeling, there is an unwholesome thought associated with unpleasant feeling that is a condition, by way of object condition. …

original: sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …pe…
analyzed: sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhamma  paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pe
translated: An unwholesome thought that is related to pleasant feeling …

original: akusalaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto ca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … pañca.🔽Abyākataṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya
analyzed: akusalam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayutto ca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā pañca  abyākatam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya
translated: An unwholesome thought that is related to pleasant feeling …🔽An unwholesome thought that is related to pleasant feeling …

original: sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ
analyzed: sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākatam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhamma  paṭicca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākata
translated: A thought that is indeterminate and related to pleasant feeling …

original: sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto
analyzed: sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ
translated: A thought that is unwholesome and related to pleasant feeling …

original: ca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: … are conditionally originated from three causes. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe nava pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate terasa
translated: In the section on root cause, there are thirteen. In the section on object, there are nine. … In the section on result, there are three. … In the section on non-distortion, there are thirteen.

original: Nahetu-naārammaṇādi🔽Abyākataṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu na ārammaṇa ādi  abyākatam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: Neither as a root cause nor as an object, etc.🔽With regard to the neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee wholesome phenomenon associated with pleasant feeling, there are three possibilities for neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee unwholesome phenomena associated with unpleasant feeling.

original: Kusalaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā. Kusalaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā kusalam sukhāya vedanāya sampayutta  dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With regard to the wholesome phenomenon associated with pleasant feeling, there is the possibility of a neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee unwholesome phenomenon associated with unpleasant feeling arising by way of object condition.🔽With regard to the wholesome phenomenon associated with pleasant feeling, there is the possibility of a neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee unwholesome phenomenon associated with unpleasant feeling arising by way of object condition.

original: Kusalaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya
analyzed: kusalam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya
translated: With regard to the wholesome phenomenon associated with pleasant feeling, there is the possibility of a neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee unwholesome phenomenon associated with unpleasant feeling arising by way of object condition.

original: sampayutto ca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti naārammaṇapaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Akusalaṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Abyākataṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya
analyzed: sampayuttaḥ ca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti na ārammaṇa paccayā tīṇi  akusalam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā tīṇi  abyākatam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya
translated: There are three kinds of objects that are skillful and associated with unpleasant feeling, and there are three kinds of objects that are unskillful and associated with unpleasant feeling.🔽There are three kinds of objects that are indeterminate and associated with pleasant feeling, and there are three kinds of objects that are indeterminate and associated with unpleasant feeling.

original: sampayutto dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā. Abyākataṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.🔽Abyākataṁ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto ca naakusalo nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti naārammaṇapaccayā
analyzed: sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā abyākatam sukhāya vedanāya sampayutta  dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā  abyākatam sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ ca na akusalaḥ na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti na ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: There are three kinds of objects that are skillful and associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, and there are three kinds of objects that are unskillful and associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: tīṇi
translated: There are three kinds of objects that are indeterminate and associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, and there are three kinds of objects that are indeterminate and associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: Nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe nava, naadhipatiyā terasa …pe… napurejāte terasa …pe… najhāne namagge tīṇi, navippayutte nava …pe… novigate nava.🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārampi paccayavārampi nissayavārampi saṁsaṭṭhavārampi sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe nava na adhipatiyā terasa pe na purejāte terasa pe na jhāne na magge tīṇi na vippayutte nava pe no vigate nava  hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe nava  na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi  sahajāta vārampi paccaya vārampi nissaya vārampi sa saṭṭha vārampi sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa
translated: With respect to non-root-cause, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to non-object, there are nine lines of reasoning. With respect to non-predominance, there are thirteen lines of reasoning. … With respect to non-decisive-support, there are thirteen lines of reasoning. … With respect to non-foundation, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to non-path, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to non-non-causally related, there are nine lines of reasoning. … With respect to non-non-concomitant, there are nine lines of reasoning.🔽With respect to root-cause as condition, there are nine lines of reasoning with respect to non-object. (In brief.)🔽With respect to non-root-cause as condition, there are three lines of reasoning with respect to object. (In brief.)🔽(The section on the origination of the simultaneous factor, the section on condition, the section on support, the section on the conjoined factor, and the section on the related factor are similar to the section on condition.)🔽🔽

original: Kusalo sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo nakusalassa nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo …pe….🔽Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe aṭṭhārasa, adhipatiyā sattarasa, anantare nava …pe… sahajāte🔽terasa, aññamaññe nava, nissaye terasa, upanissaye aṭṭhārasa, pacchājāte nava, kamme

original: 17.1.1. Akusalapada
analyzed: akusalapada
translated: … Unwholesome Direction

original: Hetu🔽Akusalaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya🔽sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: hetu  akusalam dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya  sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhamma
translated: Cause🔽With the unwholesome that is associated with painful feeling as condition there arises what is unwholesome that is not associated with painful feeling …

original: paṭicca nakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …pe…🔽akusalaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya
analyzed: paṭicca na kusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pe  akusalam dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya
translated: With the unwholesome that is associated with painful feeling as condition there arises what is unwholesome that is associated with painful feeling …

original: sampayutto ca naakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sampayutto ca na akusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With the unwholesome that is associated with painful feeling as condition there arises what is unwholesome that is not associated with painful feeling and what is unwholesome that is associated with painful feeling … (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… sahajāte aṭṭha …pe… āsevane tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… jhāne magge pañca …pe… avigate aṭṭha.🔽17.1.2. Abyākatapada🔽Paccanīya🔽Abyākataṁ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nadukkhāya vedanāya
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā pañca pe sahajāte aṭṭha pe āsevane tīṇi pe vipāke tīṇi pe jhāne magge pañca pe avigate aṭṭha  a byākata pada  paccanīya  abyākatam dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na dukkhāya vedanāya
translated: With respect to cause, there are five; with respect to object, there are six; with respect to predominance, there are five … With respect to presence, there are eight … With respect to non-disappearance, there are three … With respect to kamma result, there are three … With respect to jhāna, there are five … With respect to the path, there are five … With respect to non-conflict, there are eight.🔽The Undetermined Section🔽The Undetermined Section🔽With respect to the undetermined, there are three possibilities with respect to the unwholesome, and three with respect to the neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome.🔽With respect to the undetermined, there are three possibilities with respect to the resultants, and three with respect to the root-causeless.🔽With respect to the undetermined, there are three possibilities with respect to the fine-material, and three with respect to the immaterial.🔽With respect to the undetermined, there are three possibilities with respect to the wholesome, and three with respect to the functional.

original: Nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā aṭṭha …pe… napurejāte pañca …pe… navipāke🔽pañca, najhāne namagge nasampayutte tīṇi, nonatthiyā novigate tīṇi. (Sahajātavārampi🔽…pe… pañhāvārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Kusalaṁ adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā aṭṭha pe na purejāte pañca pe na vipāke  pañca na jhāne na magge na sampayutte tīṇi no natthiyāḥ no vigate tīṇi sahajāta vāram pi  pe pañhāvāram pi  kusalam adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to non-cause, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to non-object, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to non-predominance, there are eight … With respect to non-conascence, there are five … With respect to non-kamma, there are five … With respect to non-result, there are five … With respect to non-nutriment, there are five … With respect to non-contact, there are three … With respect to non-idea, there are three … With respect to non-condition, there are three … With respect to non-deprivation, there are three. (The section on the past, etc., is to be elaborated in the same way as the section on the present.)🔽With respect to the future, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to the present, there are three lines of reasoning. (The section on the past, etc., is to be elaborated in the same way as the section on the present.)🔽With respect to the present, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to the future, there are three lines of reasoning. (The section on the past, etc., is to be elaborated in the same way as the section on the present.)🔽With respect to the present, there are three lines of reasoning. With respect to the past and future, there are three lines of reasoning.
